channel.title: Permission to edit a Model in your game?
channel.description:
Hello there.
I don't like to work on people's content without their consent, no matter how big or small their overall projects are. So I was wondering if I could modify the am_blastdoor_top/bottom/frame models.
aka these ones. [youtu.be/8utqBcQDxxE?t=8m14s](https://youtu.be/8utqBcQDxxE?t=8m14s)
I'll be using it for a non-commerical Garry's Mod gamemode I've been working for sometime, I have tried to get in contact with it's modeler Mark. Foreman via email but had no luck getting a response from him. Was hoping if the Devs are cool with it, or there is some sort of policy on using BMS content for non-commercial use. Thanks

item.title: Permission to edit a Model in your game?
item.dc:creator: knifey
item.description:
Yeah. This is a big bump and a half. But After not doing as much as I like on this project for the time I last made this post. I’m back at it. And thanks for your permission.

But I’m really struggling to work on the door without it’s bake files or its diffuse files. Would any know if there was such content made available? Or if they ever will be? I could wing it with photoshopping the VTF file… But I don’t have much hope for good results with that.

Read full topic
item.source: Permission to edit a Model in your game?

item.title: Permission to edit a Model in your game?
item.dc:creator: TextFAMGUY1
item.description:
As long as it’s noncommercial, it’s no problem at all. Go for it!

And just for your information, the assets belong to the team as a whole, not the individual modeller. That would be a nightmare, otherwise!

Read full topic
item.source: Permission to edit a Model in your game?

item.title: Permission to edit a Model in your game?
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
Those models are in the free version of BM which was released with a standard CC license, meaning you can use them in your own projects so long as you credit the team. Bonus points if you modify them.

Read full topic
item.source: Permission to edit a Model in your game?

item.title: Permission to edit a Model in your game?
item.dc:creator: knifey
item.description:
Yeah I noticed that on my end when I first made my post, just assumed it was only me. Interesting forum bug.

But I’m actually talking about the door at 8:13

Read full topic
item.source: Permission to edit a Model in your game?

item.title: Permission to edit a Model in your game?
item.dc:creator: AsinoEsel
item.description:
Young Stallion:

If you go to the video directly by clicking the little YouTube button next to the fullscreen button, the video should have the timestamp with it.

Thanks a lot, did not know that. Cheers.

Read full topic
item.source: Permission to edit a Model in your game?

item.title: Permission to edit a Model in your game?
item.dc:creator: Cridone
item.description:
AsinoEsel:

Unfortunately, timestamps don’t work in embedded videos (at least not that I know of). Can you please tell us what part in the video you are referring to?

The piece he’s talking about is at 5:45. If you go to the video directly by clicking the little YouTube button next to the fullscreen button, the video should have the timestamp with it.

Read full topic
